Latest

  • Surgical Strike on Employment: The Record of the First Modi Government (2019-06-02)

    • The central government has finally allowed the release of the report of the 2017-18 Periodic Labour Force Survey. The previous government had blocked its release before elections because the survey showed a massive increase in the unemployment rate, worst in the last 45 years. Some data from the report that were leaked in the media showed that there had been a massive contraction in rural employment. In these Lok Sabha elections, BJP tried every trick, and with remarkable success, to distract the voters away from issues such as unemployment and livelihoods. The report perhaps saw light of the day formally only because, having won the elections with a massive mandate, the primary purpose of blocking the release of this report ceased to be relevant.

  • Prevalence of Undernourishment in Indian States (2019-04-13)

    • India is the country with largest number of people who face chronic hunger and are unable to consume even minimum dietary energy that is required given their age, body mass and activity level. This paper estimates that, in 2011-12, 39 per cent of the Indian population – a staggering 472 million people – faced chronic hunger and were unable to consume even minimally adequate amount of food.

  • Changes in the Structure of Employment in India (2018-08-08)

    • A severe contraction of employment took place in India between 2004–05 and 2011–12. NSSO surveys show a fall in work participation rates in rural and urban areas, and for men and women. This monograph presents a detailed age-cohort analysis to throw light on dynamics of changes in structure of employment in the economy.

Bibliographic database

indianstatistics.org uses a bibtex database as a centralised repository of bibliographic information. The entire database is hosted on github for public use. You can clone the repository to get the database.

We would like to invite users to contribute to further developing this database, including by contributing bibliographic information of your work on any aspect of Indian economy and society. Please send us entries in bibtex format for inclusion in the database. Trusted contributors can be given direct access to github repository to push their additions to the repository directly.

Links to other online sources of data

Contribute data

indianstatistics.org is a non-commercial initiative. We welcome contributions in terms of public data compiled by scholars and institutions as well as primary data collected and owned by scholars. If you have such data that you are willing to contribute, please go here.

Comments, queries and feedback

  • Contact us by email.
  • Or, go here for general comments
  • Join our mailing list to discuss issues related to collection, dissemination, uses and abuses of statistics on India. The mailing list can also be used to discuss tools to analyse statistics. The group should not be used for advertising any commercial activities/products.
    • To subscribe to the list, send email to indianstatistics-subscribe at lists.riseup.net.
    • To unsubscribe from the list, send email to indianstatistics-unsubscribe at lists.riseup.net.
    • To post to the list (for subscribers only), email to indianstatistics at lists.riseup.net.
